column4: Hi.  I'm trying to run mathematica over a remote X connection.  This works fine, except that mathematica requires special fonts.  I downloaded the fonts from Wolfram Research (the guys who make Mathematica), but I don't know how to install them properly.  I've tried a few things, but I don't really know what I'm doing.
you need to follow the instructions on the mathematica site.
you can test, by running xterm, and then: xlsfonts | grep <name_of_wolfram_font>
I put the type1 fonts under /usr/share/fonts/type1/mathfonts, but I still didn't have any luck.  I didn't know about the fc-update command.
did u get the unix fonts.. right ?
i have installed these once on Slackware, there was no problem.
Yes, I got the unix fonts.  I also got the windows fonts.  I attempted to install each.  No luck with either.  I'm going to try your suggestions now.
So I have downloaded tarballs of the BDF, PCF, and Type1 fonts.  I don't really get if these are the same fonts in 3 different storage formats or if I need to install all of these.
if you want to be sure, you can check /etc/X11/xorg.conf and see if it has paths related to fonts.
use the directions on site. i don't remember because i didn't think or work hard on it :-)
Ok, well, I'll look a bit further for instructions.  I looked a bit yesterday, but I didn't find anything apparently useful.
Well, it looks like this page basically says use the xset command to add it to your font path:  http://support.wolfram.com/mathematica/systems/unix/general/xsetfonterror.html
